snippet: Lincoln Center is essentially paying the Fisher family $15 million to drop the name so that the New York Philharmonic can lure a donor to finance a major renovation of its home.
abstract: Lincoln Center, home of New York Philharmonic, is paying family of Avery Fisher $15 million for permission to relinquish their name on Avery Fisher Hall, and lure a large donor with promise of renovating and renaming the orchestra's home; unusual agreement speaks to draw of naming opportunities as staple tool for arts organizations.
lead_paragraph: Lincoln Center is essentially paying the Fisher family $15 million to drop the name so that the New York Philharmonic can lure a donor to finance a major renovation of its home.

headline.main: Lincoln Center to Rename Avery Fisher Hall
headline.print_headline: Goodbye, Avery Fisher. Hello, Somebody Else.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts
